answerText: synchrotron radiation[10] Synchrotron radiation often emits this form of high frequency radiation, whose wavelength is between .01 and 10 nanometers, and which falls between UV-rays and gamma rays on the electromagnetic spectrum.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Rutgers and Virginia A | 17 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Magnetic set-ups called undulators are used to produce this type of radiation, whose radiated power is given as proportional to the velocity squared in the Larmor Formula. For 10 points each: [10] Name this type of radiation emitted by a charged particle moving at relativistic speeds when it is kept moving in a circle by a magnetic field.
